intro: Streptocarpus chariensis, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a rosette of fleshy, oval leaves. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by birds, especially sunbirds, due to their shape and nectar-rich structure. Streptocarpus chariensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
